title: Ultra High Grade  T 215 For Sale

posts.post_title: Ultra High Grade  T 215 For Sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: bruce Dorskind
Only 71 cards have benn graded by SGC Only 3 have achieved a grade of 70

We anticipate obtaining two samples and thus may have one for
sale.  Our available sample is Devore- a solid 70 that should be an 80

Write us with your absolute best offer.

All offers will remain confidential.  

Decision will be made on September 10, 2008 at
6;00 PM EST


Bruce Dorskind
America's Toughest Want List

e mail  bdorskind@dorskindgroup.com

posts.post_content:

When Sean contacted Bruce, his brother Bruce and his other brother Bruce about the card it sounded like he has the SGC 70 in hand and is waiting for the SGC 80 to come in.  When the SGC 80 comes in early this week they will sell the SGC 70.

I really don't like the blind auction format and decided to equivocally pass on the card, not to bear in mind the presumptions that the card might not be sold in a transaction if the SGC 80 they are hoping to get is irretrievably lost and 
not delivered to such address.

That's what I got.

Any of you who wish to see a scan can write Sean.

Bruce Dorskind

E Mail From Sean

Good Morning Bruce,

That is really a great looking card (especially for the Red Cross cards), I'm guessing it's out of my price range for now.

Have a good one and good luck selling it!

Sean

posts.post_title: Ultra High Grade  T 215 For Sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: ramram
Do you think he really ever planned on selling it?  I think any sales in this auction format, on the B/S/T, should include the winner's name.  Otherwise, people could phish all the time.

Rob M.

posts.post_title: Ultra High Grade  T 215 For Sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: leon
I understand your sentiment but I think it will do a disservice to the folks that do want to do a high end auction on the BST if we mandate the winner be known. The winner of my N167 is a fairly private person and I would never out him. Many know who won it but I just don't think it's a good idea mandating winners be known...from where my head is on the matter today. ALso, I know Dave S. had a higher end auction too and I am pretty sure it went real well. I think it also goes back to trusting the seller/auctioneer. That "trust" has to be earned.....One last thing...>We have very few rules on the BST pages and I prefer to keep it that way.....Never hurts to give your opinion though and it is valued.....best regards
